website_summaries.verdict: No coding required with these strips. Affordable, especially when compared to other brand name test strips designed for their meter.
pros: Uses 3-lead technology, and only initiates a reading when sufficient blood is present, so it’s a money-saver
Strips are used universal for a broad range of Prodigy meters, so if you change or upgrade, you won’t need to change your strips
cons: Can only be used with Prodigy meters
Reports of strip expiration long before its listed date

customer_reviews.title: I took a sample of blood from a blood draw ...
customer_reviews.text: I took a sample of blood from a blood draw at the clinic I go to and immediately applied it to a Prodigy strip. When the results came back, the lab said 130 the prodigy said 135. I have had diabetes for 43 years and I know how fallible meters are. There are so many problems inherent with accurate BG readings. Even lab samples can be contaminated by air. So, I'll be using these for as long as they are this accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Rob Wallace

customer_reviews.title: these are it....
customer_reviews.text: Same product as sold by others... delivered fast and securely.. these 'no code' strips by Prodigy usually give the user 100% satisfaction.... Diabetics must be able to have confidence in their blood sugar readings .. . this testing set up is about the easiest and most consistent consumer blood sugar readers out there.... Remember to control solution your sugar tester every new box of strips to make sure the strips are within the limits... but to date we have never had a vial not confirm.
customer_reviews.author: joe m

customer_reviews.title: I received the 6-pack of 300 Prodigy test strips and they're defective.
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes, they don't register at all. Sometimes it takes up to 5 test strips to get a reading! This is the first time that I've had this issue with their test strips. I had finished up my previous strips by the end of April and started on the new ones. What a disappointment! I don't test myself every morning now, since I don't know if I'll get a reading or not. That's not very good for a diabetic! I want my money refunded, but I still need test strips. Do I dare ask for a replacement order, or will they be just as defective?
customer_reviews.author: Marjorie R. Mindel

customer_reviews.title: A great bargain and health benefit a click away!
customer_reviews.text: Such an amazing price. Amazon can be such alife saver when it comes to bargains and this is definitely one of those items on that list. They always arrive fast, completely sealed and in perfect working order. I usually get 2 at a time so I don't have to worry for a while about having them on hand, but I wouldn't recommend getting more than that at one time because they expire within 12-18 months in my experience. The prices in store for test strips seems so unreasonable to me now compared to these.
customer_reviews.author: Emmy

customer_reviews.title: A good value
customer_reviews.text: I bought a 6 pack of strips, price was great. I have purchased these strips on other websites but found the price better on Amazon. Readings seem to be spot on. Definitely recommend, especially if you are checking your blood sugar multiple times a day.
customer_reviews.author: Mary S

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Saw some reviews about bad expectation. Mine don’t tell May of 2019 so can’t complain. I haven’t used mine for a while now using strips that expired close to a year ago and still accurate. (Conoared readings to my reli on). I love this prodigy meter. Cheap strips and reliable. I used it when I couldn’t see. Then got vision back and forgot could turn off the voice so went away from it. Just went back to it when realized I could.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Glucose Testing
customer_reviews.text: Had to have new test strips. Pharmacy costs are extreme. These are name brand and much better price and work perfectly. Happy customer, great purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Blaharski    517-388-1062, Flint, MI.

customer_reviews.title: Lot number and expiration date are covered
customer_reviews.text: Not sure that I can trust these to work properly. The six boxes arrived in one package with a label indicating that they are 'new'. However there is a white sticker intentionally covering the Lot number and the expiration date(which I was able to determine as 2017-07). These are for my dad, who uses insulin, so I have a strong cause for concern.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle B

customer_reviews.title: I have been buying and using these test strips for ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying and using these test strips for years. I have always gotten up to date strips. I can buy and have when I need them.
customer_reviews.author: Joyce Clayton

customer_reviews.title: Flat bottoms cause higher volume of puddles, definitely need coasters!
customer_reviews.text: These glasses stack nicely, clean looking and so far none have cracked in the few months. The only downside is that the flat bottoms make complete contact with flat surfaces and cold drinks will form big puddles. Use coasters with that will contain the liquid. I use silicone one that have a lip around it.
customer_reviews.author: Eileen

customer_reviews.title: Prodigy talking glucose meter strips are a real bargain!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for my sister. She has been paying way to much money even with her insurance covering a part of the cost. This is a real bargain and these are not even close to the expiration date. Very happy to find these and then they are delivered to her door. This is for the prodigy talking glucose meter. My sister is legally blind and cannot drive so this is wonderful! If anyone has limited sight and have not tried the Prodigy meter...you might want to try it and order your strips here!
customer_reviews.author: PrissyDixiebelle

customer_reviews.title: A much cheaper alternative
customer_reviews.text: These test strips are probably not the absolute best, but they are a hell of a lot cheaper than One Plus, etc. I'll go with these and save some bucks.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: Ordering this product in a 6 pack of 300 strips, saves time and a ton of money VS buying locally. I always receive them on time and undamaged. I highly recommend this product.

customer_reviews.title: Wildly inaccurate...

customer_reviews.title: the number is 15 to 20 points lower than one touch and contour machine i also have
customer_reviews.text: i bought this about two weeks ago and it has been consistently 15 to 20 points lower than my other two machines of different brands. at least it is consistent and i can always add 15 points to the number i read.

customer_reviews.title: useless
customer_reviews.text: this product is useless.i bought the item of 6 packs..when I start using it, my glucose kit informing not enough blood..I tried 5 strips..I opened another box..the same thing..the worst I already sent 4 packs to my sister in other country and spent more money for shipment for the product which is not working.why amazon allowing this product from Taiwan contaminate their gigantic business,especially this is a medical product...

customer_reviews.title: Bought because of the low cost test strips.

I compared the reading with FreeStyle meter/strips and got the same reading. all the competitors test strips cost 10 times more and for what?! my recommendation to all users, by Prodigy meters and test strips and save a lot of money.

customer_reviews.title: Can be scary.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: price, easy to use, needs very little blood. Cons: accuracy. I've checked and compared up to 3 different test back to back and had up to 23 point difference, 23 points is substantial when determining insulin. Unfortunately this is all I can afford.

And frankly not after super accuracy, just consistancy to know if blood sugar up or down significantly over time. Or how I may react to some new food in my diet. Anybody wants to pay over $1 a strip and use a $50 meter, more power to them.

product_meta.title: Prodigy No Coding Blood Glucose Test Strips 300 Count (50 Strips x 6 Packs)
product_meta.description: Prodigy No Coding Test Strips work with the Prodigy AutoCode, Pocket, and Voice meters. The 3 lead technology allows the meters to test only when there is enough blood on the test strip, saving the user test strips and money. The capillary action automatically draws the blood sample into the test strip. Prodigy No Coding test strips do not use GDH-PQQ technology and are approved for alternate site testing. Our glucose oxidase technology allow for safer and more accurate results. 5 Boxes of 50 strips (300 strips total).
feature_bullets: Capillary action makes testing a breeze

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
